      • onPostCreate

        protected void onPostCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Description copied from class: android.app.Activity
        Called when activity start-up is complete (after Activity.onStart() and Activity.onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle) have been called). Applications will generally not implement this method; it is intended for system classes to do final initialization after application code has run.

        Derived classes must call through to the super class's implementation of this method. If they do not, an exception will be thrown.

        Overrides:
        onPostCreate in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - If the activity is being re-initialized after previously being shut down then this Bundle contains the data it most recently supplied in Activity.onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle). Note: Otherwise it is null.
        See Also:
        Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle)

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Description copied from class: android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Dispatch onResume() to fragments. Note that for better inter-operation with older versions of the platform, at the point of this call the fragments attached to the activity are not resumed. This means that in some cases the previous state may still be saved, not allowing fragment transactions that modify the state. To correctly interact with fragments in their proper state, you should instead override FragmentActivity.onResumeFragments().
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        See Also:
        Activity.onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle), Activity.onRestart(), Activity.onPostResume(), Activity.onPause()

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        view - The view within the AdapterView that was clicked (this will be a view provided by the adapter)
        position - The position of the view in the adapter.
        id - The row id of the item that was clicked.

        onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        sensor - Sensor sensor.
        accuracy - int accuracy.

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent event)
        Listen to weather sensor change events
        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • initCharts

        private void initCharts(boolean isContinous,
              boolean isDay,
              int day)
        Initialize charts for hourly view
        Parameters:
        isContinous - true -> use .useImplicitXVals(); for X values false -> X values
        isDay - true -> get hourly records false -> get daily records
        day - day we want to get the records from 1 = today 2 = yesterday 3 = 2 days ago ...

      • clearCharts

        void clearCharts()
        Clear all charts

      • initTempChart

        void initTempChart(boolean isContinous,
                 boolean isDay,
                 java.lang.String xValueTitle,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> timeStamps,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> dayStamps,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> tempEntries,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> tempMaxEntries,
                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Float> tempMinEntries)
        Initialize temperature chart
        Parameters:
        isContinous - true -> use .useImplicitXVals(); for X values false -> X values
        isDay - true -> get hourly records false -> get daily records
        xValueTitle - title for X values as string
        timeStamps - list with time stamps of existing records
        dayStamps - list with day stamps of existing records if day view
        tempEntries - list with temperatures of existing records if day view list with average temperatures if month view
        tempMaxEntries - unused if day view list with max temperatures if month view
        tempMinEntries - unused if day view list with min temperatures if month view

      • clearTempChart

        void clearTempChart()
        Clean up temperature chart for a new initialization

        dayStamps - list with day stamps of existing records if day view
        pressEntries - list with pressures of existing records if day view list with average pressures if month view
        pressMaxEntries - unused if day view list with max pressures if month view

      • getCurrentDate

        public static int[] getCurrentDate()
        Get current date & time as string
        Returns:
        int[] Date and time as integer values int[0] = hour int[1] = day int[2] = month

      • getMinMax

        private float[] getMinMax(float[] list,
                int continousSeries)
        Get min and max values of a list
        Parameters:
        list - name of the object to test if null use continousSeries from next param
        continousSeries - 0 = tempLevelsSeries 1 = pressLevelSeries 2 = humidLevelSeries
        Returns:
        float[] float[0] = minimum value found float[1] = maximum value found

      • exportDatabase

        boolean exportDatabase()
        Read all entries from the database and write them in CSV format to the external storage File is saved in /WeatherStation/MM-dd-WeatherStation.csv MM = month dd = todays day
        Returns:
        boolean true if file could be created false if there was an error

      • backupDBasJSON

        boolean backupDBasJSON()
        Backup database in JSON format on SD card File is saved in /WeatherStation/MM-dd-WeatherStation.JSON MM = month dd = todays day
        Returns:
        boolean true => write to file successfull false => write to file failed

      • restoreFileDialog

        void restoreFileDialog()
        Show dialog with available backup files

      • restoreDBfromJSON

        boolean restoreDBfromJSON()
        Restore database from JSON format file
        Returns:
        boolean true => restore to database successfull false => restore to database failed
